snippet: Karen Alameddine, who oversaw the financial affairs of the Hereditary Disease Foundation, was accused of diverting money for her personal use.
abstract: Karen Alameddine, former controller of New York-based nonprofit Hereditary Disease Foundation, has been charged with embezzling more than $1.8 million of organization's funds and using money for personal expenses.
lead_paragraph: Karen Alameddine, who oversaw the financial affairs of the Hereditary Disease Foundation, was accused of diverting money for her personal use.

headline.main: Former Controller of Medical Nonprofit Is Charged With Embezzling $1.8 Million
headline.print_headline: Ex-Official of Medical Nonprofit Is Charged With Embezzlement
